meanings.definition: A person appointed by a government to oversee a specific area or function.
meanings.sent1: The school czars ensured that all students followed the rules.
meanings.sent2: The business czars made important decisions for the company.
meanings.sent3: The czars of bedtime declared lights out at 8 pm sharp!
meanings.sent4: She was the czar of organization, keeping everything in its place.
meanings.sent5: The czars of the kitchen whipped up delicious meals for the guests.

meanings.definition: A person with great power or authority in a particular field.
meanings.sent1: The tech czars revolutionized the way we communicate.
meanings.sent2: The fashion czars set the trends for the upcoming season.
meanings.sent3: The czars of comedy had everyone laughing with their jokes.
meanings.sent4: She was the czar of the dance floor, moving with grace and confidence.
meanings.sent5: The czars of the playground were the kids who everyone looked up to.

meanings.definition: A title used to address an emperor or king in Russia.
meanings.sent1: The history book mentioned the Russian czars who ruled the country.
meanings.sent2: The portraits of the czars adorned the walls of the palace.
meanings.sent3: The czars of old would have never imagined modern technology.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a czar in her elegant gown at the ball.
meanings.sent5: The czars of the past left a lasting legacy in Russian history.
